On 17 November 2021, local women denuded themselves and demonstrated against the increasing presence of elephants in the area, claiming that these were destroying the crop fields and demanding action to local authorities, in Lii (Nwoya, Northern). [size=no report]

Defusal: On 17 November 2021, police forces defused a bomb, which had been placed under a tree, in Kawempe (Kampala, Central). The bomb was suspected of belonging to ADF group, which had already perpetrated suicide bomb attacks on the previous day (coded separately).

On 17 November 2021, local residents and councilors demonstrated against the diversion of water supplies, claiming that this would deny access to clean water for local population, in Bududa (Bubulo, Manafwa). [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Joint Anti-Terrorism Task Force
notes: On 17 November 2021, Anti-Terrorism military forces shot dead a suspected ADF leader in Nsangi (Busiro, Wakiso), while he was trying to run away from arrest. The man was responsible for recruiting suicide bombers that had detonated themselves on the previous day (coded separately). UPDF claimed there was a clash between soldiers and the suspected ADF militiaman, but witnesses, family members and others refused this claim, declaring this was an extrajudicial killing. There was one fatality.

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Joint Anti-Terrorism Task Force
source: Independent (Uganda); New Vision (Uganda); Nile Post; Chimp Reports; URN (Uganda); Daily Monitor (Uganda)
notes: On 16 November 2021, Anti-Terrorism forces from UPDF shot and killed an armed ADF militiaman in Bwaise (Kampala, Central), who had previously killed a civilian under unclear circumstances (coded separately). When UPDF soldiers stormed the ADF militiaman's house, they also found an explosive device. Military forces then detonated the explosive device without accident. There was one fatality.

source: Chimp Reports; Nile Post; Independent (Uganda); New Vision (Uganda); Daily Monitor (Uganda); URN (Uganda)
notes: On 16 November 2021, an ADF militiaman assaulted and killed a man, in unclear circumstances, in Bwaise (Kampala, Central). There was one fatality.

source: URN (Uganda); Chimp Reports; Daily Monitor (Uganda); Nile Post; Independent (Uganda); New Vision (Uganda)
notes: On 16 November 2021, an ADF suicide bomber detonated himself in front of the Central Police Station in Nakasero (kampala, Central). The explosion killed four people, including two policemen and the suicide bomber, and injured 17. IS claimed the responsibility for the attack.

source: Nile Post; URN (Uganda); Independent (Uganda); New Vision (Uganda); Chimp Reports; Daily Monitor (Uganda)
notes: On 16 November 2021, two ADF suicide bombers on a motorcycle stopped on the Parliament road and detonated themselves, in Nakasero (Kampala, Central). Three people were killed in the explosion, the two suicide bombers and one civilian, and 16 civilians were injured. IS claimed the responsibility for the attack.

On 16 November 2021, police forces arrested a group of 28 armed people, led by an Internal Security Organization officer, in Nakuwadde village, near Kireka (Kira, Wakiso). The group was composed by unidentified armed men, some of whom in military uniforms, who were attempting to raid the village over land disputes.

On 16 November 2021, a vigilante mob of local residents attempted to attack the house of a UPDF captain in Kireka (Kira, Wakiso), after one of his guards beat and killed a man a few days earlier. Police and military forces were deployed to disperse the mob. There were no fatalities nor injuries. [size=no report]

Looting: On 16 November 2021, unidentified armed cattle rustlers looted around 10 heads of cattle from the local bishop's property in Moroto (Northern). There were noone in the house during the looting, and there were no fatalities nor injuries.
On 15 November 2021, shop owners and traders demonstrated against the increased rent for obtaining license in the market, in Gulu (Northern). [size=no report]

On 15 November 2021, Kampala Capital City Authority employees demonstrated against the non-payment of their salaries for September and October and against the poor work conditions, in Kawempe (Kampala, Central). [size=no report]

On 15 November 2021, Palacam and Longuti clan militias signed an agreement, to end a land dispute that had caused a clash between the two clans on the previous week (coded separately), in Potika (Lamwo, Northern).
Looting: On 14 November 2021, Karamajong armed pastoralists looted 38 heads of cattle from a civilian's house, in Olilim (Otuke, Northern).
On 14 November 2021, local residents demonstrated against the killing of a resident by a private security guards, in Kireka (Kira, Wakiso). [size=no report]

On 13 November 2021, NUP supporters demonstrated against an impeding access to a radio to the opposition figure, Bobi Wine, in Lira (Northern). Police forces shot live bullets and teargas against demonstrators, injuring one NUP supporter. There were no fatalities. [size=no report]

On 12 November 2021, NUP supporters demonstrated against the prohibition of access of Bobi Wine to a local radio station by security forces, in Mbale city (Eastern). Police forces intervened with teargas and bullets to suppress the demonstration. There were no fatalities nor injuries. [size=no report]

On 12 November 2021, a vigilante mob of local residents burnt alive and killed a man, who had previously killed a woman in the area, in Biguri (Kibale, Kamwenge). Police forces intervened with teargas and bullets to disperse the mob. [size=report]

On 12 November 2021, four unidentified armed men got our of a cab in which they were travelling, and shot dead two unidentified civilians for unclear reasons, in Jinja (Eastern). There were two fatalities.

On 11 November 2021, a vigilante mob of local residents beat and killed a man, who was suspected of stealing two goats and a sheep, in Kibiriizi parish, in Bamunanika (Luwero, Central). There was one fatality. [size=no report]

Defusal: On 11 November 2021, UPDF forces discovered two explosive devices, picked them and defused them without incident, in Kapeeka (Nakaseke, Central), a few hours after another explosive device had exploded, killing one person and injuring 4 (coded separately).

source: Nile Post; Chimp Reports; Weekly Observer
notes: On 11 November 2021, an explosive device belonging to an unidentified armed group exploded, killing one person and injuring 4, in Kapeeka (Nakaseke, Central). The explosive device was hidden in a metal waste collection point. There was one fatality.

On 11 November 2021, local residents and parents demonstrated over the need for legal knowledge in the area, in order to avoid conflict in the community, in Mutungo (Makindye Ssabagabo, Wakiso). [size=no report]
On 11 November 2021, local residents demonstrated against the absenteeism of health workers, accusing them of neglecting the coronavirus vaccination campaign, in Kasese (Western). [size=no report]
Looting: Around 11 November 2021 (week of), an unidentified communal militia of pastoralists looted 600 heads of cattle from civilians' houses in Moroto district (Northern).
Looting: Around 11 November 2021 (week of), an unidentified communal militia of pastoralists looted 1200 heads of cattle from civilians' houses in Nabilatuk district (Northern).

On 11 November 2021, a vigilante mob of pub owners and workers abducted, beat and tortured a man, suspected of theft, in Masaka city (Central). The man was tortured for one week, and then left in the hospital, after local residents organized a demonstration to release him (coded separately). There were no fatalities. [size=no report]

Around 11 November 2021 (week of), Palacam clan armed members clashed with Longuti clan militia in Potika (Lamwo, Northern), over a land dispute. Five people were seriously injured, 20 huts were set on fire and many properties were destroyed. There were no fatalities.
On 10 November 2021, local residents demonstrated against the thefts perpetrated by police forces in the area, in Kakindo (Bugahya, Hoima). [size=no report]

On 10 November 2021, an explosive device belonging to an unidentified armed group exploded, severely injuring two children, in Kuji 1 Village, Kuji Parish, Tirinyi (Kibuku, Eastern). There were no fatalities.

On 10 November 2021, a flying explosive device fell on the ground and exploded in a populated place, in Nvunanwa village, Segalye parish, Semuto (Nakaseke, Central). There were no fatalities nor injuries.
On 9 November 2021, Karamajong armed pastoralists attacked a shop owner and his wife, injuring them and looting their money and belongings, in Orom (Chua, Kitgum). There were no fatalities.
On 9 November 2021, an explosive device belonging to the UPDF forces exploded, seriously injuring two children, in Kasese (Western). There were no fatalities.

On 8 November 2021, over 1,000 students on strike demonstrated against the increase in school fees in Kabale (Western). Some students turned violent and started to throw stones against police forces, who in turn fired tear gas and live bullets in the air to disperse them. One police officer and one student were injured, and two student leaders were arrested. [size=over 1,000]

On 8 November 2021, UPDF forces clashed with Pokot armed pastoralists in Lorengedwat (Pian, Nabilatuk) as the latter were looting around 10,000 heads of cattle. One UPDF officer was injured, and a woman was killed in the crossfire. There was one fatality.

On 7 November 2021, unidentified machete-armed men stormed a bar, where many people were watching a football match, and attacked civilians for unclear reasons, in Kicwabugingo, Kiryandongo district (Western). One old man was killed, and others were injured.

On 7 November 2021, a vigilante mob of local residents demolished at least 11 houses and killed cattle belonging to a family, accused of witchcraft, in Ayivu (Arua, Northern). Around 50 family members were forced to flee. There were no fatalities nor injuries. [size=no report]

On 7 November 2021, an unidentified machete-armed man stormed the house of the local MP, and tried to kill her, in Sembabule (Mawogola, Ssembabule). The victim found refuge in a room, and police forces intervened to rescue her. This attack comes a few days after the MP petitioned the Parliament against harassment from the Minister of Health. There were no fatalities nor injuries. [women targeted: politicians]

On 6 November 2021, a mob of bar guests stoned to death a UPDF officer, while he was enforcing curfew rules, in Kigorobya (Bugahya, Hoima). Eleven people were then arrested. There was one fatality. [size=no report]

On 6 November 2021, local residents beat and injured the Deputy District Commissioner, his driver and other community leaders, after they attempted to stop a land sensitization meeting, in Kitimbwa (Bbaale, Kayunga). There were no fatalities. [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Joint Anti-Terrorism Task Force
notes: On 5 November 2021, Joint Anti-Terrorism forces from UPDF shot dead a suspected unarmed ADF militiaman, when he tried to escape from his arrest, in Kawempe (Kampala, Central). The UPDF had found at the suspected ADF member's house an explosive suicide belt, an AK-47 and some ammunitions.

On 5 November 2021, unidentified armed pastoralists from South Sudan clashed with UPDF, while crossing the South Sudanese border in Lawiye parish, Madi Opei Sub County (Lamwo, Northern) after looting cattle three days earlier (coded separately). One UPDF was killed during the clash.

On 5 November 2021, a vigilante mob of local residents beat and stoned to death a man, who had previously killed a man and injured his wife in a theft attempt, in Mpigi (Mawokota, Central). There was one fatality. [size=no report]

Around 5 November 2021, a UPDF officer and two unidentified armed men killed a boda boda rider, for unclear reasons, in Ibanda (Western). The man was abducted on 5 November and his body was found one week later.

On 5 November 2021, a group of youths beat up the Kayunga Deputy District Resident Commissioner, his driver and other community leaders at Kyelima, in Kitimbwa sub-county (Kayunga, Central). The victims went to stop a land sensitization meeting organized by the Cultural leader of the Banyala community in Kayunga. [size=no report]
On 4 November 2021, street traders and their leaders demonstrated against the closure of weekly markets due to coronavirus restrictive measures, in Kabale (Western). [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Joint Anti-Terrorism Task Force
notes: Defusal: On 4 November 2021, Joint Anti-Terrorism forces from UPDF raided the house of a suspected ADF member, who had participated in the suicide bomb attack on the previous week, and defused an explosive device, in Kireka (Kira, Wakiso). The suspected ADF militiaman was not at home during the raid.
On 3 November 2021, local residents demonstrated against the lack of clean water in the area, in Lukaya (Kalungu, Central). [size=no report]
On 3 November 2021, environmental activists demonstrated against a motion in Parliament that removed three forest from the status of 'protected areas', in Kayunga district (Central). [size=no report]

Looting: Around 3 November 2021 (week of), unidentified communal militias of armed pastoralists looted around 1500 heads of cattle and 545 goats from local residents, in the Northern region (coded as Moroto). There were no fatalities nor injuries.
Looting: On 2 November 2021, unidentified armed pastoralists from South Sudan looted goats in Oryang village, Madi Opei sub country (Lamwo, Northern). There were no fatalities nor injuries.

On 2 November 2021, a mob of students assaulted the official university founder and some unidentified people, who had tried to chase away students from university, in Kirima (Kinkizi, Kanungu), among the institution's ownership disputes. Police forces intervened to rescue the victims. [size=no report]
On 1 November 2021, more than 50 local residents demonstrated against the damages on their properties caused by a private water company business, in Katosi (Mukono, Central). [size=more than 50]

On 1 November 2021, a vigilante mob of local residents threw stones against a truck driver and set his vehicle on fire, after he killed a man in a car accident, on the highway 6km from Arua (Northern). The truck driver found refuge in his company venue, and there were no fatalities nor injuries. [size=no report]

On 31 October 2021, environmental activists demonstrated against the removal of eco-tourism equipment and activities by a private company, in Kijabwemi natural reserve near Masaka (Central). [size=no report]
On 31 October 2021, UPDF clashed with Karamajong armed pastoralists in Lopei (Bokora, Napak), killing three militiamen.
On 31 October 2021, Karamajong armed pastoralists attacked the Nawet village, Nasinyonoit parish in Lorengedwat (Nabilatuk, Northern). The group undressed women and looted food.

On 31 October 2021, a mob of local residents beat and seriously injured the local MP over a land dispute, in Lubowa (Makindye Ssabagabo, Wakiso). Police forces intervened to rescue the victim. [size=no report]

On 30 October 2021, a chief intelligence officer from UPDF, together with other two people, abducted a man, demanding a ransom for his release, in Kamwezi (Rukiga, Western). There were no fatalities nor injuries.

On 30 October 2021, local residents and the local chairperson demonstrated, throwing stones and injuring police officers, against the police directive to enforce curfew, in Wobulenzi (Katikamu, Luwero). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration, shooting live ammunition against demonstrators and seriously injuring two. One victim died after a few hours. [size=no report]
On 29 October 2021, a bomb, placed by an unidentified armed group, killed three children in Nakaseke (Central).

Looting: Around 28 October 2021 (week of), unidentified armed pastoralists looted cows and goats and other animals from local farmers, during the night, in various locations of Kagadi district (Western). There were no fatalities nor injuries.
Around 28 October 2021 (week of), police forces arrested 48 people, suspected of participating in ADF bomb attacks, in Kampala area (Central).
Around 28 October 2021 (week of), UPDF arrested 60 Karamajong armed pastoralists in the Northern area (coded as Moroto), due to a disarmament operation led by local authorities.

Around 28 October 2021 (week of), police forces arrested around 15 Palaro clan members, suspected of attacking civilians on the previous week over a land dispute, and tortured them in the prison, in Pawel (Kilak, Amuru). There were no fatalities, and two victims were then released.

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Joint Anti-Terrorism Task Force
notes: Defusal: On 27 October 2021, the Anti-Terrorism task force of UPDF detonated in a safe area a bomb planted by an unidentified armed group, in Kawanda (Mawogola, Ssembabule). There were no fatalities nor injuries.

On 26 October 2021, traders and local residents demonstrated against the corruption of the anti-money laundering office, in Kisenyi (Kampala, Central). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration. [size=no report]
On 26 October 2021, a vigilante mob of local residents beat and killed a man, who had previously attacked his family with a panga, in Mubuga (Bufumbira, Kisoro). [size=no report]

On 26 October 2021, a police officer clashed with UPDF, after he decided to visit the scene of a fire incident, in Lorengecora (Bokora, Napak). The UPDF considered that the policeman was responsible for the accident, and an armed clash began. The police officer was killed, and there were no other fatalities nor injuries.
On 26 October 2021, a mob of family members beat and seriously injured a man, over a land dispute, in Rubaya (Kashari, Mbarara). There were no fatalities. [size=no report]

source: New Vision (Uganda); URN (Uganda); Red Pepper (Uganda); Chimp Reports; Daily Monitor (Uganda)
notes: On 25 October 2021, a suicide bomber ADF militiaman detonated himself on a bus in Lugala (Butambala, Central). Two people were killed, including the ADF suicide bomber, and several others were seriously injured.

On 25 October 2021, a vigilante mob of local residents beat and killed a man, who had previously stolen food items, in Namumira (Mukono, Central). [size=no report]
On 25 October 2021, more than 20 local residents demonstrated against the violence perpetrated by a police officer against a young woman, in Amolatar (Kioga, Northern). [size=more than 20]
On 25 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the eviction from their land and the demolition of their house by police forces, in Mbale (Eastern). [size=no report]
On 25 October 2021, Karamajong armed pastoralists shot three civilians, including a boda boda driver, in Panyangara (Kotido, Northern). There were two fatalities and one injury.
On 25 October 2021, over 500 local residents demonstrated against the delay in the release of funds for a development project in Buwenge (Kagoma, Jinja). [size=over 500]

On 25 October 2021, over 100 local residents demonstrated against the election as the district chairperson of a man, who had been already accused of fuelling land grabbing activities in the area, in Kyangwali (Buhaguzi, Kikuube). [size=over 100]

On 23 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the damages caused by thunderstorms the previous days, denouncing the lack of aid from local authorities, in Kabowa (Kampala, Central). [size=no report]
On 23 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the killing of a man by a mob over a private dispute, in Kitumba (Kabale, Western). [size=no report]

On 23 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the presence of a stone quarrying company in the area, claiming that this would cause environmental damages, in Opwateta (Pallisa, Eastern). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration. There were no fatalities nor injuries. [size=no report]

On 23 October 2021, ADF militiamen placed an explosive device in a populated place and detonated it, killing one civilian and severely injuring four, in Kawempe (Kampala, Central). The attack was claimed by IS. There was one fatality and four serious injuries.

On 22 October 2021, local residents and some MPs demonstrated against the election of a particular board chairperson, claiming that this would worsen the land grabbing activities, in Kabwoya (Buhaguzi, Kikuube). [size=no report]

On 22 October 2021, local residents and environmental activists demonstrated against an oil pipeline project, claiming that this would cause environmental damages in the area, in Kyotera (Central). Police forces intervened and arrested some environmental activists. [size=no report]
On 22 October 2021, Palaro clan militia attacked a local family over a land dispute in Pawel (Kilak, Amuru), severely injuring four people. There were no fatalities.

On 22 October 2021, an unidentified militia of 10 people attacked civilians in Kiteezi (Kyadondo, Wakiso), killing three and injuring dozens. The victims reported that this attack was perpetrated over a land dispute in the area. There were three fatalities and dozens of injuries.
On 21 October 2021, UPDF clashed with Karamajong armed herders over a theft of cattle occurred a few hours earlier, in Orom (Chua, Kitgum). One militiaman was killed.
On 21 October 2021, dozens of women demonstrated against some remarks made by the Gender Minister, in Lira (Northern). [size=dozens]

On 21 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the construction of an oil road made by a private Chinese company, claiming that this had caused environmental damages on the water supplies, in Kabwoya (Buhaguzi, Kikuube). [size=no report]

On 21 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the damages on their crop fields caused by local pastoralists, in various locations in Pakwach district (Northern) [coded to Pakwach]. [size=no report]

On 20 October 2021, Karamajong armed pastoralists looted several heads of cattle from a community kraal in Orom (Chua, Kitgum). UPDF intercepted the militiamen and clashed with them. There were no fatalities nor injuries.
On 20 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the land conflicts in the area, demanding governmental interventions, in Ishaka (Bushenyi, Western). [size=no report]

On 19 October 2021, more than 100 local residents demonstrated against the alleged land grabbing attempts of the local legislator, accusing him of taking advantage of a forest land, in Ayivu (Arua, Northern). Police forces intervened to disperse the demonstrators. There were no fatalities nor injuries. [size=more than 100]
On 19 October 2021, a landmine planted by an unidentified armed group exploded, injuring three children, in Lira Palwo (Agago, Northern). There were no fatalities.

On 19 October 2021, a vigilante mob of local residents beat and seriously injured a man, who had previously killed his two brother's children over a land dispute, in Kabira (Ruhinda, Mitooma). Police forces intervened to disperse the mob, and to rescue and arrest the victim. There were no fatalities. [size=no report]

On 19 October 2021, UPDF clashed with Karamajong militiamen, who had looted 700 heads of cattle, in Kalapata (Dodoth, Kaabong). There were 10 fatalities, all among Karamajong cattle rustlers, and two injuries among UPDF.

On 18 October 2021, around 100 tobacco farmers demonstrated against the non-payment of their salaries by a private tobacco company, in the Terego area (Arua, Northern, coded as Ocea). [size=around 100]

assoc_actor_2: Government of Uganda (1986-); NUP: National Unity Platform; Women (Uganda)
notes: On 18 October 2021, an armed man invaded the local NUP MP's house and held her hostage, in or around Mukono (Central). On 17 October 2021, a vigilante mob of boda boda riders beat and killed a man, who had previously knocked and injured a boda boda rider in a car accident, in Mengo (Kampala, Central). [size=no report]

On 16 October 2021, fishermen demonstrated against the spread of diseases, due to lake pollution, in Bukakata (Bukoto, Masaka). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration. There were no fatalities nor injuries. [size=no report]

On 16 October 2021, an unidentified armed group of 15 people attacked a Chinese private company, clashing with police forces in charge of security, and raping two employees, in Myanzi (Kassanda, Central). During the clash, two people were killed, one among police forces and one among assailants.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Special Forces Command
notes: On 16 October 2021, UPDF arrested the leader of the Uganda Homeland Liberation Force in the northern region (coded as Moroto), after special forces command and intelligence had contributed to detect his position.
On 16 October 2021, local residents and community leaders demonstrated against the joint military and police operations against cattle rustlers in the area, in Moroto (Northern). [size=no report]
On 16 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the environmental damages on water supplies caused by the waste of an abattoir, in Gulu (Northern). [size=no report]
On 15 October 2021, a vigilante mob of local residents beat and killed a man, who had previously killed a woman in a bar, in Nyakinoni (Kinkizi, Kanungu). [size=no report]

On 14 October 2021, a vigilante mob of local residents set fire and destroyed motorcycles belongings to two men, suspected of looting cattle, in Bulera (Mityana, Central). The mob tried to beat and kill the two victims, but they managed to flee. Police forces intervened to disperse the mob, and to avoid vigilantes to find the suspected thieves. [size=no report]
Looting: On 14 October 2021, Karamajong militiamen ambushed two businessmen and looted their money and belongings in Panyangara (Kotido, Northern). There were no fatalities nor injuries.
On 14 October 2021, teachers demonstrated against the non-payment of their salaries in the previous three months in Mbale (Eastern). [size=no report]

On 14 October 2021, Karamajong armed pastoralists attacked the regional governmental inspector of mines at his house, in Moroto (Northern). The victim managed to flee and hide from militiamen. There were no fatalities nor injuries.

On 13 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the poor state of a bridge in the area in Kasokoso (Kira, Wakiso), claiming that this was putting their lives at risk. Police forces intervened to disperse the demonstrators. [size=no report]
On 13 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the poor state of roads in the area, in Buhesi (Burahya, Kabarole). [size=no report]
On 13 October 2021, police forces attacked, beat and injured many civilians during curfew enforcement operations in Fort Portal (Kabarole). There were no fatalities.

On 13 October 2021, local residents and business people demonstrated against the removal of solar street lights near Kabale (Western), claiming that this was producing a shortage in energy in the area. [size=no report]

On 13 October 2021, local residents violently demonstrated, erecting barricades and boulders, against the poor state of roads in the area, in Gulu (Northern). [size=no report]

On 12 October 2021, a vigilante mob of local residents, including a catholic priest, beat and killed a man, who had tried to loot the priest's house, in Masaka (Central). [size=no report]

On 12 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the presence of food vendors near the community water sources, claiming that the waste generated by their business was causing serious contamination dangers, in Kawempe (Kampala, Central). [size=no report]

On 12 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the poor health service delivery by health workers, in Buseta (Kibuku, Eastern). Police forces intervened firing tear gas to disperse demonstrators. [size=no report]

On 11 October 2021, an unidentified armed group attacked a local town clerk and his wife for unclear reasons, in Lira (Northern). The local politician was killed, and his wife seriously injured.

On 8 October 2021, local residents demonstrated against the alleged political persecution of a local MP in Kiyunga (Luuka, Eastern). [size=no report]

On 8 October 2021, the ADF militiamen placed an IED in a police station and detonated it, injuring several police officers and destroying the police post, in Kawempe (Kampala, Central). The attack was claimed by IS. There were no fatalities.

On 7 October 2021, local councilors and residents demonstrated against the decision of government to suspend local leaders, due to local politics altercations, in Kasubi (Kampala, Central). Police forces intervened to suppress the demonstration. There were no fatalities nor injuries. [size=no report]

On 6 October 2021, nursing students demonstrated against the inefficient and ineffective administration of their university in Kabale (Western). Around 8 February 2021 (as reported), a fight broke out between NRM supporters and supporters of an independent candidate at Buyonjo Primary School polling station in Mbale (Mbale Municipality, Mbale). The NRM candidate and his supporters accused the polling officials for opening the polling station without the ten witnesses as stipulated by the electoral commission laws and assaulted the head teacher of the school hosting the polling station, accusing him of voter bribery. At a nearby station, the same group started another fight and the NRM group was pushed out of the station by NUP supporters. One person was reportedly injured and hospitalised. [size=no report]

source: Daily Express (Uganda); All Africa; Vanguard Africa

source: Weekly Observer; France24; New Vision (Uganda); Daily Monitor (Uganda); URN (Uganda); Independent (Uganda); HRW; BBC News
notes: On 19 November 2020, thousands of NUP supporters rioted in several locations in Kampala after Bobi Wine (MP) was arrested the previous day. Police, UPDF, LDU paramilitaries and unknown armed men in civilian attire used live rounds, beatings and tear gas, killing at least 49 in Kampala and wounding over 100 (dozens seriously) across two days of clashes. Five fatalities concern civilians, shot dead by police officers while not rioting in addition to 11 police whilst making 577 arrests. Looting and robbery were reported during the events. A number of other civilians were among the dead, including 5 market vendors. Some observers filming the events were also fired upon.
