actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
notes: On 30 March 2020, LDU paramilitaries were reported to have attacked civilians in the Kawempe area of Kampala, ostensibly as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. Three of the LDUs have been convicted in a military court, and sentenced to short terms in prison.

On 29 March 2020, police and residents of Wakiso attacked a shelter for gay, lesbian, transgender and bisexual civilians in Wakiso (Waksio district), ostensibly as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. 23 people were beaten and arrested.

As reported on 29 March 2020, Ugandan military intelligence personnel reportedly abducted and tortured at least two Rwandans who had been living in the area of Jinja (Jinja district), ostensibly as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. The source also states that the victims, along with 342 other Rwandans, were then left at the Rwandan border by Ugandan authorities.
On 28 March 2020, police fired upon a group of six people in Bududa town (Bududa district), injuring one. The attack was ostensibly part of coronavirus enforcement measures.

On 28 March 2020, the village of Vurra in Katiyi Parish (Arua district) was attacked by militia from the neighbouring Odrubu village in a Madi-inhabited area, as part of a land dispute. The attackers wounded 8 residents of Vurra, burned 13 dwellings, destroyed property, and stole food and livestock.

On 27 March 2020, police beat a number of civilians at a bar in Busega (Kampala) whilst enforcing coronavirus lockdown measures. The police attacked a heavily pregnant lady who had taken shelter from rain at the bar, and who was unable to flee the beatings. Three police have been arrested.

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
notes: On 26 March 2020, LDU paramilitaries beat an unspecified number of market vendors and boda boda drivers (using wires and sticks) in Kampala, as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. Several LDU members have been arrested in connection with the incident, and additional LDU officers have been arrested in connection with attempting to extorting individuals travelling in night-time hours.

On 26 March 2020, police shot and wounded two construction workers riding with a boda boda driver in Mukono (Mukono district), ostensibly as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. The police officers are being investigated.

On 26 March 2020, residents of Pamoju and Pamoti villages in Moyo district burned tyres on the road to Moyo town, after the government attempted to use an area near to the villages for coronavirus quarantining purposes. Police fired tear gas to disperse the demonstrators. [size=no report]
On 25 March 2020, police and UPDF were attacked by youths throwing stones at Nyabyeya (Masindi district), in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]
On 24 March 2020, unknown people threw stones at soldiers in Kampala, wounding a soldier in the mouth. The event occurs in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]

On 24 March 2020, police and UPDF were attacked by unknown people throwing stones at Nagagumba Trading Centre along the Sironko-Mbale road (event presumed to be in Sironko district, given that the majority of the road is in this district), in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]
On 23 March 2020, soldiers were attacked by youths throwing stones in Rubaya (Mbarara district), in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]

On 23 March 2020, Ugandan police forces used live bullets to disperse crowds of traders in violation of coronavirus measures at markets in Bududa district and arrested an unknown number of them. Resulting injuries are unknown.

On 22 March 2020, a group of riders nearly lynched a businessman from South Africa in Kyabirwa village in Budondo sub-county (Kagoma, Jinja), after the man boasted of entering Uganda without having to quarantine for coronavirus. [size=no report]

On 21 March 2020, police fired tear gas and beat market traders who had turned up to Otuboi market (Kaberamaido district), in spite of a presidential ban on public gatherings to limit the spread of coronavirus. The source does not mention that the traders were demonstrating, nor that they fought back against the police.

actor2: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Prison Guards
notes: On 21 March 2020, Ugandan prison guards clashed with prisoners during a prison riot in Arua (Arua Hill, Arua Municipality, Arua). 3 prisoners were killed, 6 were injured, and 8 were recaptured as approximately 23 prisoners attempted to escape. It is unclear what prompted the rioting. [size=approximately 23]

On 21 March 2020, youths threw stones at soldiers in Kisoro town (Kisoro district), in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures, wounding one UPDF soldier in the leg. Two of the youths were arrested. [size=no report]

On 20 March 2020, a lynch mob attacked a Kenyan trader residing in Nampirika (Iganga district), accusing him of bringing coronavirus to Uganda after he developed a heavy cough. Although the man was beaten, he was able to escape, and fled to a nearby police station. [size=no report]
On 20 March 2020, a mob descended on a man accused of attempted rape and stabbed him to death in Lamogi (Lamogi, Kilak, Amuru). [size=no report]

source: Daily Monitor (Uganda); Weekly Observer; PML Daily
notes: On 20 March 2020, the Ugandan government introduced a series of partial lockdown measures in anticipation of the coronavirus pandemic, including closures of schools, places of worship, and all demonstrations. The measures were tightened with border closures announced on 25 March, and a two-week lockdown came into force on 31 March. On April 14, it was announced that lockdown measures were to be extended until 5 May.

On 19 March 2020, traders clashed with police at a market in Kisoro town (Kisoro district), after traders had previously been ordered to relocate to a different market. The traders threw stones at police, who fired live rounds at the traders, wounding two (one of whom was shot in the neck). [size=no report]

On 19 March 2020, unspecified security forces (presumed to be police) beat a journalist who was taking photos of police shutting down a bar at an unspecified area of Kitgum district, under coronavirus lockdown measures.

On 17 March 2020, butchers protested in Kabale (Kabale district), after the abattoir constructed by local authorities was deemed to have failed to meet basic safety standards due to a lack of running water. [size=no report]

On 17 March 2020, a lynch mob attacked a woman they accused of practicing witchcraft in Rwengabi village in Kaseeta parish (Kikuube district). The mob beat her until she was unconscious. Police intervened to disperse the crowd, prompting the mob to throw stones at the police. Police responded by firing live rounds, but hit two of the crowd (with what are described as stray bullets). One man died the following day, and the other is critically injured. [size=no report] [women targeted: accused of witchcraft/sorcery]

actor2: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Prison Guards
notes: On 16 March 2020, Jie raiders shot a prison officer who was supervising inmates from Amita prison (Abim county) working at a nearby farm, and stole his weapon. The officer died of his wounds shortly after.

On 16 March 2020, a group of around 100 villagers from Guruguru village attacked Giragira village in Kilak county (Amuru district). In addition to abducting several residents of the village - and torching and looting property - the attackers gang-raped at least one woman. There is no clear motive for the attack mentioned in the source.

On 16 March 2020, demonstrators gathered once again in Jinja (Jinja district) to condemn the poor quality roads in the area. The demonstrators burned tires, placed rocks on the road, and dug trenches. Police fired tear gas and live rounds at the demonstrators, shooting a passer-by (who was not involved in the demonstration) in the hip. [size=no report]

On 15 March 2020, a lynch mob killed a man in Kategure village in Kyanamira sub-county (Kabale district), after he had thrown stones at the house of the LC1 Chairman of the village. Six have been arrested for leading the attack, including the LC1 Chairman. [size=at least six]

assoc_actor_1: FDC: Forum for Democratic Change; PP: People Power; Students (Uganda)
notes: On 15 March 2020, People Power and FDC supporters demonstrated after police were deployed at student elections underway in Kyambogo University (Kampala). Police fired tear gas and live rounds (likely in the air) to disperse the demonstrators. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-); Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
notes: On 14 March 2020, Matheniko raiders (working alongside Turkana raiders from Kenya) attacked a kraal at Namaire in Panyangara subcounty (Kotido district). They engaged in a firefight with UPDF, LDU paramilitaries, and Police Anti-Stock Theft Unit personnel. One LDU and three Turkana raiders were killed, and five UPDF wounded.

On 14 March 2020, UPDF ambushed Karamajong raiders at Lakongera village, Chua county (Kitgum district). A civilian from nearby Apimoto village was wounded after two bullets hit him (possibly in the crossfire, although details are unclear). The civilian was taken by UPDF soldiers for medical treatment.
On 14 March 2020 (or possibly on 15 March 2020), demonstrators gathered in Jinja (Jinja district) to protest against the poor quality of the roads in the area. [size=no report]

On 12 March 2020, police and military intelligence officers raided the home of retired Lt. Gen Henry Tumukunde (who announced that he would be running for the presidency against President Museveni the previous week) in Kololo (Kampala). The candidate was arrested and charged with treason in relation to remarks he made during a TV interview (allegedly inciting Rwanda to intervene in upcoming elections); his staff of 18, as well as the MP for Tororo North (his campaign coordinator) as well as his son have all been arrested.

Around 11 March 2020 (week of), residents of Bugembe (Jinja district) burned rubbish on roads in the town, condemning the poor state of roads in the area. Police later arrested eight alleged ringleaders. [size=at least 8]

On 10 March 2020, street vendors clashed with police in Kampala after police attempted to arrest a vendor. Police officers fired rubber bullets into the crowd, but shot one round into a teenage girl who was uninvolved in the event, knocking out three teeth. The girl's mother was hit in the arm with a rubber bullet, and another man was also wounded in the leg. [size=no report[

On 9 March 2020, taxi drivers protested at the Kampala Capital City Authority HQ, calling for authorities to enforce recent changes to taxi stands in the city, following a similar protest in January. [size=no report]

On or around 8 March 2020, clan members of a woman killed in Aoji village in Odoro parish, Aromo sub-county (Lira district), burned 13 houses in Aloji in a revenge attack. The violence is linked to an intra-clan feud. Those involved are likely to be of Lango ethnicity.

On 7 March 2020, the nephew of the former Ugandan vice-president under Idi Amin was abducted by suspected members of the Gimara clan of the Kakwa ethnic group at his farm in Anyanga village in Kuluba sub-county (Koboko district). His decomposing and dismembered body was discovered on 5 April. The killing is suspected to be linked to a land dispute.

On 7 March 2020, seven attackers armed with pangas killed a woman and her young daughter in Aoji village in Odoro parish, Aromo sub-county (Lira district). They then burned their house with the bodies inside. The attack is linked to an intra-clan feud. Those involved are likely to be of Lango ethnicity. [women targeted: girls]

On 6 March 2020, striking Ugandan bus drivers demonstrated at the Elegu-Nimule border post (presumed to be in Elegu, Amuru district), after a group of South Sudanese money exchangers attacked and broke the arm of a Ugandan bus driver in Nimule. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
source: URN (Uganda); West Nile Web; Daily Monitor (Uganda)
notes: On 6 March 2020, UPDF pursued an unknown communal militia (the majority of whom are suspected of being residents of Zombo district, and at least some who are likely to be Lendu militiamen from the DRC) who had attacked them earlier that day in Zombo, intercepting them at Zonga village in Patek parish (Zombo district). Dozens were arrested during and after the clash. The UPDF have announced that they killed 17 militiamen; media sources have given varying figures suggesting 20-23 were killed (with one report indicating that three militiamen were killed by local residents in the sub-county and in Nyapea). The UPDF has also disputed reports that the attackers were part of a new rebel group.

assoc_actor_1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
source: Xinhua; Daily Monitor (Uganda); West Nile Web; Chimp Reports; URN (Uganda)
notes: On 6 March 2020, an unknown group of raiders (estimated by some sources at numbering around 100, with the majority believed to be Zombo district residents, and including at least some militiamen from the Lendu Congolese ethnic group) armed with basic hand weapons and bows attacked a UPDF base near Zombo town (Zombo district). Five UPDF were killed (at least one of whom dying of their injuries after the attack) and two were wounded. Initial information suggested that three of the attackers were killed, though this figure has been dropped from subsequent reporting. The attackers reportedly stole a small number of weapons. There is no clear motive for the attack at present; authorities have dismissed suggestions that the attackers are part of a new rebel group.

assoc_actor_2: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On or after 6 March 2020, residents of Zombo district were reported to have killed three unidentified attackers (mainly from Zombo district, but which also included several members of the Congolese Lendu group in their ranks) in Nyapea and/or Jangukuru areas of Okoro county (Zombo district).
On 4 March 2020, police arrested 10 People Power activists holding a private meeting in Jinja town. The police were reported to have beaten the activists.
On 3 March 2020, students demonstrated in Moroto (Moroto district), due to a lack of clean water at the school. [size=no report]
On 3 March 2020, traders demonstrated in Kampala, following repeated electricity blackouts in Luwum street. [size=no report]
Around 1 March 2020, or 29 February 2020, residents of Kasese town (Kasese district) demonstrated against a shortage of medicines at the local government health centre. [size=no report]

On 26 February 2020, residents of Kyagunda village in Bukulula subcounty (Kalungu district) blocked a road required by a Chinese infrastructure contractor, following complaints that the drivers of the company were damaging houses and crops in the area, and driving recklessly. [size=no report]

On 26 February 2020, FDC members protested in Jinja town (Jinja district), following the arrest of the former party leader earlier that day (he had been due to address a rally). There is no further information. [size=no report]

actor2: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
notes: On 25 February 2020, police and LDU paramilitaries dispersed People Power supporters with tear gas and live rounds as they demonstrated in Nansana (Wakiso district), following the burial of a colleague killed in a motor accident. One demonstrator killed after being shot in the head by an LDU soldier, and several demonstrators wounded. Authorities have alleged that the demonstrators threw stones at the police, and are investigating the shooting. [size=at least several]
On 25 February 2020, a man (who was accused of sexually assaulting an underage girl) was killed by a lynch mob in Mungaaro village in Bubaare subcounty (Rubanda district). [size=no report]

On 25 February 2020, youth blocked a road in Nakulabye (Kampala), calling for the body of a man shot dead by an LDU soldier in Nansana that same day to be returned to the family (who reside in Nakulabye). The youth engaged in 'running battles' with the police, who later agreed to return the body, on the condition that politicians did not attend the funeral. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Prison Guards
notes: On 25 February 2020, police arrested three land rights activists in Kisalanda village near Kakwoko (Kiryandongo district), transferring them to prison, where they were tortured. Upon their release on bail on 12 March, their houses were bulldozed.

On 24 February 2020, police fired tear gas and live rounds (assumed aerial fire) in Kabale town (Kabale district) at People Power supporters participating in a rally, held amidst student elections at the University in Kabale. [size=no report]

On 24 February 2020, People Power supporters clashed with police in Ndeeba, after police prevented them from holding a meeting. Tires were burned by the PP supporters, whilst police used tear gas and live rounds against the demonstrators, and arrested six. [size=at least 6]

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
notes: On 24 February 2020, police and LDU paramilitaries fired tear gas at FDC supporters holding a political rally in Njeru (Buikwe district). [size=no report]

On 23 February 2020, a lynch mob comprising of boda boda drivers (and possibly others) attempted to kill a suspected thief in Kakumiro town (Kakumiro district). Police intervened and opened fire, hitting three (including another police officer) with live rounds, including a student who died from their injuries. [size=no report]

On 23 February 2020, Christian protesters marched in Ngora (Ngora district), amidst a dispute over elections for the position of Bishop in the area. Police arrested over 30 demonstrators. [size=at least 30]
On 23 February 2020, Christian protesters marched in Kumi (Kumi district), amidst a dispute over elections for the position of Bishop in the area. [size=no report]

On 20 February 2020, over 60 residents of rural areas around Njeru demonstrated in Njeru town (Buikwe district), calling for compensation after a private company damaged property and crops in their villages. [size=over 60]

On 20 February 2020, a 'scuffle' broke out between the supporters of an academic and police outside of a courthouse in Kampala, following the quashing of her conviction for insulting the President. Live rounds were fired into the air to disperse the crowd. [size=no report]

On 19 February 2020, students rioted at Kigezi College in Kabale town (Kabale district), after a student was suspended for extorting other students. His colleagues threw stones at teachers and damaged property, before attempting to torch the headteachers' residence. Police used tear gas and fired live rounds into the air to disperse the students. [size=no report]

On 18 February 2020, hundreds of boda boda drivers marched in Kampala claiming that police were harassing them. The demonstrators were blocked by police, leading to clashes. Police used tear gas and live rounds (presumed to be fired into the air) to clear the demonstrators. [size=hundreds]

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
notes: On 16 February 2020, a fisherman was shot dead and another wounded by a UPDF Fisheries patrol near Kisenyi village on Lake Albert (Rubirizi district). The UPDF Fisheries spokesman alleged that the soldiers acted in self-defence, and were being threatened by the fishermen, who were attempted to hit them with their oars.

On 14 February 2020, an Imam was killed by at least four unknown attackers in Busimba in Iwemba subdistrict (Bugiri district). Four people have been arrested; police have accused the ADF rebel group of being involved, although this is not confirmed.

On 14 February 2020, over 500 casual workers from a tungsten mine in Karra parish (Rubanda district) demonstrated following the abrupt closure of the mine by its international owners, which has left many without an income. Police prevented the demonstrators from marching to Rubanda town to lodge their grievances. [size=over 500]

On 14 February 2020, Democratic Party youth protested (and interrupted) at a party meeting which they believed would remove the Party Organising Secretary (supposedly on the grounds that he supported the People Power movement). The demonstration happened in the Mengo area of Kampala. Police were deployed, but did not become involved. [size=no report]

On 13 February 2020, taxi drivers demonstrated in Kabale town (Kabale district) following the decision of the Uganda Road Works Authority to prevent taxi drivers from using part of the road outside of their building. Police used tear gas and live rounds into the air to disperse the demonstrators, who had blocked the roads. [size=no report]

On or before 11 February 2020, parents and students of a primary school in Kasongi in Lugusuulu subcounty (Mawogola, Ssembabule) protested following the unexpected movement of the schools' headteacher to Ntuusi subcounty, calling for authorities to leave the headmaster in place. [size=no report]

On 8 February 2020, taxi drivers demonstrated in Kabale town (Kabale district), following the decision of the Uganda Road Works Authority to prevent taxi drivers from using part of the road outside of their building. [size=no report]

On 8 February 2020, truck drivers blocked the Kampala-Masaka road at Lukaya town (Kalungu district), calling for the release of a colleague of theirs who had been arrested for failing to pay a fine related to avoiding weighing station. [size=no report]

actor2: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
notes: On 7 February 2020, Matheniko fighters shot dead an LDU paramilitary guarding a cattle kraal in the Lapan Namigut area (Napak district), and stole his weapon.

actor1: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Uganda Wildlife Authority
notes: On 7 February 2020, a civilian from Kapkoros subcounty was shot and wounded by a UWA park ranger after he was discovered (with others) grazing his livestock at an unspecified part of Mt. Elgon National Park (coordinates for Kapkoros, Kongasis county, Bukwo district, used at geoprec2). The UWA have claimed the attack was in self-defence, after the group resisted arrest, and the victim attempted to attack the park ranger (event coded as VAC pending further info).

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
notes: On 7 February 2020, around 30 men armed with pangas (and accompanied by 3 LDU paramilitaries) attacked farmers working on land belonging to a Christian University in Ntaawo (Mukono district), wounding six, and destroying crops and property on the farm. The violence is linked to a land dispute involving a businessman.

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
notes: On 7 February 2020, two fishermen were pursued by alleged members of the Fisheries Protection Unit (and who have been coded as such) at an unspecified area near Bussi island (coordinates for Gulwe, Busiro county, Wakiso district, used at geoprec2). Upon apprehending the men, the FPU soldiers cut off their hands. There is no clear motive. Four people have been arrested.

On 6 February 2020, raiders from Karamajong (and coded as such) clashed with a UPDF soldier guarding a kraal at Katabok village in Lokopo subcounty (no geographic information found, coordinates for Napak, Lokopo subcounty, Napak district, used at geoprec2). The soldier was killed and his weapon taken by the raiders.

On 5 February 2020, over 800 teachers from several schools demonstrated during a training event at a school in Iganga town (Iganga district), in protest against unwelcome changes to the curriculum, and against a miserly stipend to cover transport to the school. Police intervened and arrested one teacher. [size=over 800]

On 5 February 2020, a lynch mob killed a business man linked to the murder of his sister as he was hiding in Butabo cell in Ruhinda subcounty (no geographic information found, coordinates for Mitoma, Ruhinda county, Mitooma district, used at prec2). Police have arrested four in connection with the vigilante action. [size=at least 4]

Around 5 February 2020 (week of), security forces (coded as army) clashed with raiders from Kotido district (coded as Jie militia) at an unspecified location in Kotido district close to the border with Orom subcounty in Kitgum district (coordinates for Lobul, Jie county, Kotido district, used at geoprec2). One cattle raider was killed.

On 3 February 2020, residents of Odolo village in Morulem subcounty barricaded a road in Rackoko parish (no geographic information found, coordinates for Morulem town, Abim district, used at geoprec2), after their area was once again excluded from road improvement works, and amidst allegations that the engineer in charge of the project was profiting from selling materials required for the road. The demonstration lasted at least three days. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-); Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit; Private Security Forces (Uganda)
notes: On 28 January 2020, residents of Kalerwe suburb (Kampala) attacked private security with stones and set up barricades, in demonstration against an operation to shut down illegal electricity connections. Police, UPDF, and LDUs (who had accompanied the private security) were also present, and police (coded as actor1) used tear gas to disperse the crowds. [size=no report]
On 27 January 2020, FDC supporters were prevented by riot police from holding a rally in Muhanga (Rukiga district). [size=no report]

On 27 January 2020, members of the Koki clan of the Acholi attacked Kalabong (Kitgum district), in a revenge attack directed at members of the Yom clan following the killing of a Koki teenager several days before. The source does not mention whether anyone was injured, and instead notes that property was vandalised and looted.
On 27 January 2020, FDC supporters were prevented by riot police from holding a rally in Rubanda town (Rubanda district). [size=no report]

On 24 January 2020, a man was injured by unexploded ordnance (likely left from fighting between the UPDF and LRA) in Wilul village in Paicho sub-county (coordinates for Paicho, Aswa county, Gulu district, used at geoprec2).

assoc_actor_1: FDC: Forum for Democratic Change; Civilians (Uganda); Journalists (Uganda)
notes: On 22 January 2020, FDC supporters clashed with police in Jinja (Jinja district) during a rally in the town, whilst the ex-FDC leader was arrested (alongside a journalists who was conducting a radio interview with the ex-leader). [size=no report]
On 20 January 2020, FDC supporters marched in Jinja (Jinja district), but were dispersed by police, who beat an unspecified number of supporters in Masese III slum. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2020, FDC supporters marched in Mbale town (Mbale district) in a belated celebration of the 15 year anniversary of the formation of the party, but were intercepted by police, who also arrested the FDC party chairman. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2020, Turkana cattle raiders attacked Kamour village in Panyangara sub-county (coordinates for Panyangara, Jie county, Kotido district, used at geoprec2), and clashed with UPDF soldiers stationed at the village to prevent raiding. In the crossfire, four pastoralist teenagers were killed (one of whom died at a hospital having been injured in the gunfire).

On 20 January 2020, FDC supporters marched in Soroti town (Soroti district), but were intercepted by police. FDC supporters threw stones at the police and burned tires in the roads, before police (and UPDF reinforcements) dispersed the crowd with tear gas and beatings, wounding three (including a six-month old child). Two police officers have been arrested. [size=no report]

On 15 January 2020, four youths attacked the speaker of the Ntungamo district assembly at Ntungamo town (Ntungamo district) with pepper spray. The incident is reportedly linked to the speaker's intention to contest a seat of a former ally in upcoming elections. [size=4]

On 15 January 2020, a mob of boda boda drivers attempted to kill a suspected motorbike thief in Kalerwe (Kampala). Police intervened, and rescued the victim before he could be set alight. [size=no report]

During the month of January 2020, taxi drivers protested at the Kampala Capital City Authority HQ, calling for authorities to enforce recent changes to taxi stands in the city. The drivers say that some taxi drivers are not respecting the changes, which is penalising those who have adhered to them. [size=no report]
On 13 January 2020, anti-corruption activists marched in Kampala. Police intercepted the demonstrators, and arrested 13 organisers. [size=at least 13]

On 13 January 2020, two UPDF members guarding a cattle kraal were killed by Turkana fighters at Toruchup in Losilang parish (Kotido district). The attackers then stole the weapons belonging to the soldiers.

On 12 January 2020, members of the Teso ethnic group lynched a Karamajong man in Apeitolim (Napak district) after he was spotted sharing a motorbike with the wife of a Teso inhabitant. [size=no report]

On or after 12 January 2020, members of the Karamajong ethnic group (coded as Karamajong militia) attacked members of the Teso group living in Apeitolim (Napak district), torching 24 dwellings, and killing a small child who was in one of them. The attack is a retaliation for a lynching that took place on 12 Jan. 20 were arrested following the attack.

On 10 January 2020, miners marched to Ruhaama (Ntungamo district) from surrounding areas, in protest at alleged abuses by police officers directed towards them, and the low prices paid by a mineral trading firm in the area (which has a monopoly on trade). Police attempted to prevent demonstrators from marching, though were unsuccessful in doing so.[size=400]

As reported on 10 January 2020 (and implied to have occurred recently; time precision 3 used) a mob attacked milk vendors at an unspecified location in Ssembabule district, assaulting the vendors and vandalising their property. A local MP is suspected of organising the mob. [size=no report]

On 10 January 2020, pastoralists staged a demonstration in Lwemiyaga (Ssembabule district) in which they attempted to take their cattle to sale at the market, despite a ban due to an outbreak of foot and mouth disease. Police arrested a local MP who organised the demonstration. [size=no report]

On 8 January 2020, two UPDF soldiers were stabbed by three Karamajong raiders at a water pump in Nakapelimoru sub-county (Kotido districts). The raiders then stole the weapons of the wounded soldiers.

actor1: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Uganda Wildlife Authority
notes: On or after 8 January 2020, a charcoal burner was killed near Sosomi in Buluganya subcounty (Bulambuli district, coordinates for Buluganya used at geoprec2). UWA - who were conducting operations in the area at the time - are suspected of killing the civilian, and have been coded as actor1.

On 7 January 2020, a lynch mob comprising South Sudanese refugees attempted to kill a man suspected of murdering two refugees. A police officer intervened, but one refugee took the officer's weapon and shot the officer dead. The event occurred in Onyire village (Moyo district, coordinates for Logoba used at geoprec2). [size=no report]

On or after 7 January 2020, boda boda drivers protested in Mukono town (Mukono district), carrying the body of a colleague (who had been killed after being hit by a commercial taxi) to the police station, and demanding the release of their colleagues who had earlier attempted to mobilise boda drivers for a demonstration. [size=100]

source: Chimp Reports; Daily Monitor (Uganda); URN (Uganda); AP
notes: On 6 January 2020, People Power supporters gathered in Kasangati (Wakiso district) to welcome Bobi Wine MP's run for the presidency. Police blocked the road and arrested Bobi Wine, before firing tear gas and rubber bullets at his supporters (who were reported by police to have blocked roads with wood and tires, and engaged in clashes with police, and have been recorded as rioters pending further information), with one police officer wounded by a stray rubber bullet. (Note that initial reports claiming that an infant had died from inhaling tear gas were incorrect, according to police) [size=no report]

On 6 January 2020, People Power supporters gathered in Gayaza (Wakiso district) for a rally in support of the movement and of Bobi Wine MP's run for the presidency. Police arrested several protesters who refused to vacate the area, and fired tear gas upon the crowd. [size=no report]

actor1: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Uganda Wildlife Authority
notes: On or after 6 January 2020, a charcoal burner was killed near Kitsatsa village in Bumayoka subcounty (Bududa district, coordinates for Bufuma used at geoprec2). UWA - who were conducting operations in the area at the time - are suspected of killing the civilian, and have been coded as actor1.

On 6 January 2020, People Power supporters demonstrated in Kasangati (Wakiso district) against measures by authorities to prevent Bobi Wine MP from launching Consultative Meetings as part of his Presidential run. Police claimed that the supporters threw stones at police, wounding one officer, and that 'many' were arrested. [size=at least many]

On 30 December 2019, a lynch mob attempted to kill a suspect bike thief in Mukono town (Mukono district), before attacking a police officer who had come to intervene. Police reinforcements arrived, and dispersed the mob with tear gas and live rounds. [size=no report]

On 29 December 2019, unexploded ordnance (believed to have been from violence dating back to the counter-insurgency against the LRA) detonated in Latigi Parish (Pader district), killing a civilian who had accidentally damaged it whilst gardening.
On 27 December 2019, UPDF clashed with Jie raiders at Loputuk village in Nadunget sub-county (Moroto district, coordinates for Nadunget used at geoprec2), killing one Jie raider.
On 25 December 2019, a lynch monb attacked two suspected thieves in Gulu town (Gulu district). Police intervened to save the two suspects. [size=small]

On 25 December 2019, police shot and killed a civilian during an problem at a nightclub in Mukatesani (Rukungiri district, coordinates for Mutozho used at geoprec2). Police have claimed they were attacked by the patrons of the club.

On 25 December 2019, UPDF clashed with cattle raiders from Kotido district in Rupa sub-county (Moroto district). The source describes two of the raiders as being 'put out of action', and have been coded as fatalities at fatality prec2.
On 24 December 2019, UPDF clashed with Kenyan Pokot raiders near Nakapiripirit town (Nakapiripirit district), killing two Pokot raiders.

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
notes: On 23 December 2019, the UPDF Fisheries force entered Bugulu landing site (Buvuma district, coordinates for Kirongo used at prec2), assaulting residents and confiscating property. The event occurred despite the Ugandan parliament suspending the unit, following multiple incidents in which it abused civilians.

On 21 December 2019, a lynch mob killed two suspected thieves and burned their bodies. The incident occurred in Kitgum (Kitgum district), and one accomplice of the suspect thieves escaped. [size=no report]

actor2: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
notes: On 19 December 2019, the Ugandan parliament has suspended the operations of the UPDF Fisheries Unit, following numerous reports of abuse and torture linked to the Unit. It is unclear how long the suspension will last for.
On 19 December 2019, UPDF ambushed suspected Matheniko raiders at an unspecified location in Kotido district (coordinates for Kotido town used at geoprec2), killing three and capturing one.

On 18 December 2019, residents of Hamurwa sub-county marched from Hamuko to Hamurwa (Rubanda district, coordinates used at geoprec2), in opposition to the very poor quality of the road in the area, and the absence of improvements despite the allocation of money for the road. Police prevented the demonstrators from proceeding, although allowed 11 chairpersons of villages to continue the march. [size=500]

On 17 December 2019, demonstrators (coded as rioters) attempted to dig up boundary pillars which had been put on disputed land at Namakole (Mbale district). Riot police fired into the crowd, hitting a civilian who was not involved in the demonstration, and who died of his wounds shortly after. [size=no report]

actor2: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
notes: On 17 December 2019, protesters demonstrated at Moroto and the nearby Kidepo barracks (Moroto district, one event coded), following the killing of an LCIII chairman earlier that day. Soldiers (coded as LDU) dispersed at least some of the demonstrators. [size=hundreds]

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
notes: On 17 December 2019, an LCIII chairman attempted to prevent Local Defence Unit soldiers from seizing cattle (taken due to allegations they had been rustled). He was then shot dead by an LDU. The incident occurred at Kidepo army barracks (Moroto district).

On 17 December 2019, a lynch mob killed a suspect in a defilement case who had been released on bail in Lopulingi parish (Lamwo district), after he became involved in a brawl with his family. [size=small]
On 16 December 2019, UPDF clashed with Karamajong raiders in Nakapelimoru sub-county (Kotido district, coordinates for Nakapelimoru used at geoprec2), killing three and arresting one.

On 16 December 2019, a mentally ill man with a panga was intercepted by a mob in the village of Namayonjo (Nakasongo district; coordinates for Kisalizi used at geoprec2). The brother of the man intervened and the mob to release him, but a police officer shot the man dead, claiming he had become violent.

On 15 December 2019, members of the Palukere Acholi clan (armed with hand weapons and bows) attacked the Pali Pali Acholi clan in the area of Palukere (Amuru district), setting fire to 52 dwellings and stealing cattle, and displacing 500. A former army officer is linked to the attacks, which are variously described as being linked to a land dispute or for the death of the officer's brother (who may have died during the event, though this is unclear).

Around 15 December 2019 (month of), a lynch mob killed a suspected goat thief in or near Aduku (Kwania district). Seven people were arrested in June 2020 in connection with the killing. [size=at least 7]

On 13 December 2019, market vendors burned tires on the roads at the Kame suburb of Mukono town (Mukono district), in demonstration against the failure of local authorities to re-establish electricity in the area. Police dispersed the demonstrators with tear gas. [size=no report]
On 13 December 2019, police arrested a number of People Power activists as they marched in Makindye (Kampala), and attempted to mobilise residents of the area to join the march. [size=small]
On 12 December 2019, police fired tear gas at People Power activists demonstrating in Kamwokya (Kampala), and made a number of arrests. [size=no report]

On 12 December 2019, Dinka refugees mobilised in retaliation for an attack the previous day, and attacked several Madi villages in Ajugotti parish (Linga, Maiciki, Ege, Jurumini and Maiaeiciki villages. One event coded at Jurumini, Adjumani district, at geoprec2). One Madi man was killed, and around 12 injured (some seriously). Dwellings were also torched, and looting occurred.

source: URN (Uganda); Daily Monitor (Uganda); Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya
notes: On 11 December 2019, a Madi militia attacked Dinka refugees at Nyumanzi camp (Adjumani district), after the unexplained death of a Madi civilian in the camp the previous day. In the clashes between the Madi and Dinka, at least one Dinka refugee died (one report says six, though this is not corroborated by others), and injuring around 11 (some seriously, with injuries spread across both groups).

On or before 9 December 2019, UPDF exchanged fire with Kenyan Turkana raiders at an unspecified location in Napak district (coordinates for Napak town used at geoprec3). The raiders fled, and abandoned the cattle they had looted.

On 5 December 2019, casual labourers working for the Ugandan Road Authority protested at the HQ of the authority in Kabale (Kabale district), having been unpaid since May of 2019. The manager of the authority has agreed to pay the workers by the end of the week. [size=30]

assoc_actor_1: Taxi Drivers (Uganda); NRM: National Resistance Movement
notes: On 5 December 2019, protesters (including boda boda drivers) - who are reportedly aligned to the NRM (and coded as such) - demonstrated in Kisenyi (Kampala), against a petition to have Museveni indicted at the International Criminal Court. Police dispersed the protesters. [size=dozens]

On 4 December 2019, police prevented an anti-corruption march by the FDC party (designed to mirror a similar march led by President Museveni) in Mpererwe and surrounding areas of Kampala. Upon intercepting ex-FDC leader Dr Bisigye, FDC youths and police engaged in clashes. [size=no report]

On 1 December 2019, students attacked two men in Rukungiri (Rukungiri district), one of whom was alleged to have stolen clothes from a student dormitory. The students then handed the victims to the police. One of the victims died of his injuries the following day. [size=2]
On 27 November 2019, unemployed men demonstrated in Kampala against corruption and unemployment. Police arrested one protester, who was reported to be in possession of a machete. [size=no report].

On 27 November 2019, a lynch mob killed a local withdoctor after he (and two colleagues) were found at a Catholic shrine in Kazekolere (Burahya district, coordinates for Rutete used at geoprec2). The two colleagues escaped. Police have arrested six people in connection with the attack. [size=small]

On 26 November 2019, protesters gathered in Kabowa (Kampala) to protest the closure of a footpath by a factor owner. A police officer fired several rounds at the protesters, shooting a demonstrator in the head, and killing him. The officer has been arrested. [size=no report]
On 26 November 2019, road workers protested at the local authority offices at Busia (Busia district), demanding salary arrears to be paid. [size=no report]

On 23 November 2019, taxi drivers blocked roads with their vehicles in Nansana (Wakiso district) in protest at the presence of a rival group of taxi drivers who have recently been moved to a nearby taxi stage. [size=no report]

On 21 November 2019, police dispersed Bobi Wine's People Power supporters with tear gas as they marched at the funeral of Human Rights Commissioner Haj Muhammad Kaggwa (known by his alias of Med Kaggwa) at Lufaka village on the outskirts of Mpigi town (Mpigi district, coordinates for Mpigi used at prec2). [size=500]

On 19 November 2019, striking workers at the Bidco industrial plant in Masese (Jinja district) demonstrated, against poor working conditions, unpaid overtime, arbitrary taxation from the company, and job insecurity. [size=1000]
On 13 November 2019, two suspected cattle ruslters (of Congolese nationality) were killed by a lynch mob at Ambaku village (Maracha district, coordinates for Oluvu used at geoprec2). [size=no report]

On 12 November 2019, a mob of parents attacked a primary school teacher at Lacor (Pader district, coordinates for Atanga used at prec2), after he had repeatedly showed up at work drunk. Police intervened and took the teacher into custody. [size=small]

assoc_actor_1: FDC: Forum for Democratic Change; Women (Uganda)
notes: On 6 November 2019, police prevented a march of female FDC supporters at the FDC headquarters in Najanankumbi (Kampala). Reports (which are not enitrely consistent) say that police fired tear gas into the office building after protesters threw stones and other items at the police (another report does not mention stone-throwing; actor 1 provisionally coded as Rioters and SET as Violent Demonstration). [size=dozens]
On 4 November 2019, journalists demonstrated in Kampala against infringements against press freedom by Ugandan security organs. Police beat several journalists and arrested one. [size=small]

On 4 November 2019, FDC supporters held a demonstration in Kireka (Wakiso district). Police used tear gas and water cannons against supporters. Video footage emerged of police smashing the vehicle of former FDC leader Dr Kizza Besigye and threatening its inhabitants with a firearm, before filling the vehicle with pepper spray. Dr Besigye was arrested, along with a number of his aides; eight FDC supporters were later arrested. [size=large]

On 1 November 2019, Balaalo pastoralists attacked three civilians (including an LC1 chairman) at Alinyiri village (Arua district, coordinates for Rigbo used at geoprec2). The attack appears to relate to disputes over access by the Balaalo to land in the area.

On 1 November 2019, two police officers beat a civilian with batons and threatened to kill him, before robbing him, in or near Ruhaama town (Ntungamo district). The attack comes amidst a spate of similar attacks by police on residents of the area.
On 1 November 2019, police arrested student demonstrators at Gulu University (Gulu district) who were protesting in solidarity with colleagues at Makerere University. [size=70]

On October 30th or 31st, residents of Forest Ward on the outskirts of Gulu marched to the Resident District Commissioner's office in Gulu (Gulu district), to demand that two local politicians be released. The politicians are accused of mobilising a mob to clear a witch doctor off land in the area. [size=hundreds]

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 31 October 2019, four Ugandan fisherman were abducted by suspected Congolese militiamen at Lake Albert, after they set of from their landing site at Kijangi (Hoima district, coordinates for Kabanda used at precision). The abductors are demanding a ransom. The event is the latest in a series of attacks against Ugandan fishermen.

On 30 October 2019, protesters gathered at Makerere Univeristy (Kampala) as part of continued protests against a cumulative fees increase. Police used tear gas and live rounds to disperse the students. [size=no report]

On 30 October 2019, police fired tear gas inside a student dormitory in Makerere neighbourhood (Kampala), after its residents began whistling at them. The police then fired at journalists covering the events.
On 30 October 2019, pork vendors marched in Kabale (Kabale district), calling for a quarantine on pigs from the area (imposed due to an outbreak of swine fever) to be lifed. [size=40]
On 29 October 2019, police fired tear gas against journalists covering protests at Markerere University (Kampala), and arrested three.

On 29 October 2019, students gathered at Markerere University (Kampala), as part of sustained demonstration against a cumulative fee increase. Police fired tear gas against demonstrators. [size=no report]

On 29 October 2019, over 100 village chairmen demonstrated at the District HQ in Budaka town (Budaka district), following the non-payment of money promised to them for their role in an immunisation campaign in the area. [size=100]

On 29 October 2019, police and UPDF fired upon a group of demonstrators who had reportedly attacked them during voting in Palarinya (Moyo district). A woman was shot in the head, but appears to have survived. [size=small]

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
notes: On 29 October 2019, soldiers from the FPU raided several homes in or near Kisalaizi parish (Nakasongola district), beating fisherman and other labourers. A woman was killed in the process, and eight civilians wounded, one of whom died at a later time, implied to be shortly after. Soldiers have claimed they were responding to aggression from one fisherman, who attacked a soldier with a bladed weapon. (Event coded as VAC/Attack)

On or around the weekend of October 26th-27th, Kenyan Turkana raiders attacked areas around Nakapelimoru (Kotido district), killing one 14 year-old boy, and abducting a 12 year-old boy. The attackers looted 2,000 head of cattle and hundreds of sheep and goats, and displaced hundreds of Karamojong civilians. The attacks come amidst a spate of raids in Kotido. Two events coded at time prec2, with fatality assigned to first day.

On or around the weekend of October 26th-27th, Kenyan Turkana raiders attacked areas around Nakapelimoru (Kotido district), killing one 14 year-old boy, and abducting a 12 year-old boy. The attackers looted 2,000 head of cattle and hundreds of sheep and goats, and displaced hundreds of Karamojong civilians. The attacks come amidst a spate of raids in Kotido. Two events coded at time prec2, with fatality assigned to first day.

actor1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 25 October 2019, Congolese militiamen in army fatigues (suspected of belonging to the Lendu ethnic group, and coded as such) attacked a group of Ugandan fishermen at Kaiso landing site close to Tonya (Hoima district, coordinates used), attempting to rob them, and killing three.

source: Weekly Observer; Daily Monitor (Uganda); URN (Uganda); Chimp Reports
notes: On 25 October 2019, 15 journalists covering a student press conference (which was addressing the unrest at Mekerere University over the previous three days) were beaten and had tear gas fired upon them by police forces at Makerere University (Kampala).

On 25 October 2019, demonstrators gathered on Saaka road in Fort Portal (Kabarole district), in protest at the poor condition of the road. Demonstrators blocked the road with rocks, logs, and dug trenches. [size=no report]

source: Weekly Observer; Daily Monitor (Uganda); Chimp Reports; URN (Uganda)
notes: From October 22nd-24th, 2019, students demonstrated at Makerere University (Kampala), over the introduction of a cumulative tuition fee increase. UPDF and police used tear gas and live rounds against protests, with reports of beatings and arrests across the three days. [size=large]

On 24 October 2019, a People Power activist was beaten unconscious and abducted by an unknown group of men in Kamwokya (Kampala). She was held for four days (during which time she was interrogated on her political activities), and released in Kawempe.

On 24 October 2019, men in police and army uniforms (and coded as such) attacked Gazi market in the dispute Apaa area (Amuru district, coordinates for Apaa used at prec2). The attackers destroyed market stalls, fired live rounds, and arrested 2. 2 people are also reported to be missing.

source: Chimp Reports; Weekly Observer; URN (Uganda); Daily Monitor (Uganda)
notes: From October 22nd-24th, 2019, students demonstrated at Makerere University (Kampala), over the introduction of a cumulative tuition fee increase. UPDF and police used tear gas and live rounds against protests, with 100 students arrested and beaten on the second day of protests. [size=large]

source: URN (Uganda); Daily Monitor (Uganda); Weekly Observer; Chimp Reports
notes: From October 22nd-24th, 2019, students demonstrated at Makerere University (Kampala), over the introduction of a cumulative tuition fee increase. UPDF and police used tear gas and live rounds against protests, with reports of beatings and arrests across the three days. Several students were also arrested as they attempted to march to President Museveni's state house. [size=large]
On 22 October 2019, student protesters (led by women) demonstrated at Wandegeya police station (Kampala), following the arrest of student demonstrators that same day. [size=no report]
On 20 October 2019, a group of people in Kampala (Kampala Capital City, Kampala) attacked a gay Rwandan refugee. The mob inflicted severe blows to his head. [size=no report]

On 18 October 2019, a lynch mob (including boda boda drivers) killed a suspected motorcycle thief in Luwero town (Luwero district) and torched the body. Another suspect fled from the crowd and took shelter at a nearby police station, which the mob then attempted to storm, before being dispersed by tear gas fired by police. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Government of Uganda (1986-); Police Forces of Uganda (1986-)
notes: On 18 October 2019, residents of Kayabwe brawled with local politicians at a meeting in Kayabwe (Mpigi district), following disagreements on local security and administrative issues. Police intervened to stop the fighting. [size=small]
On or around October 17th, residents blocked the Busajjabwakuba road in Nakaloke (Mbale district), protesting the poor condition of the road. [size=no report]

Around 15 October 2019 (month of), police officers in Kampala (Kampala Capital City, Kampala) carried out two mass arrests and abused detainees because of their sexual orientation. No casualties and/or injuries reported.
Around 15 October 2019 (month of), a group of people in Kampala (Kampala Capital City, Kampala) attacked a LGBT shelter. [size=no report]

On 14 October 2019, vendors blocked a road in Masaka town (Maska district) with burning logs, to demonstrate against the poor quality of the road (which diverted waste water into their stalls). Police used tear gas and live rounds to disperse the riots. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Uganda); Taxi Drivers (Uganda); Military Forces of Uganda (1986-)
notes: On 14 October 2019, a mob (which included a UPDF sergeant, and boda boda drivers) attacked a suspected thief in the Nakawa division of Kampala. Police intervened to rescue the victim, and used live rounds to disperse the mob. The victim later died of his injuries. [size=small]

On 11 October 2019, a plain-clothes police officer was tied up by a mob who then threatened to lynch them, after he ordered them to vacate an area of land in the area of Lwanyonyi-Kiringira (Mukono district, coordinates for Lukojjo used at prec2). The officer was saved after intervention from the land owner. The incident occurs amidst a land dispute involving eviction. [size=small]
On 11 October 2019, a lynch mob killed two suspected thieves in Mpigi town (Mpigi district). [size=small]

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-); Private Security Forces (Uganda)
notes: On or before October 9th, a Chinese businessman was rescued from a lynch mob in Kampala, after his bodyguard had shot and wounded a market vendor who had repeatedly protested against the businessman's parking of a truck outside of his workplace. [size=no report]
On 5 October 2019, taxi drivers drove from Kanungu to Kabale (Kabale district, coordinates used), in protest at the lack of security along the road. [size=no report]
On 5 October 2019, a mob attacked a suspected group of kidnappers outside a bar in Kampala, beating one of the alleged criminals unconscious. [size=small]

source: Civil Rights Defenders; HRW; African Media Agency
notes: On 4 October 2019, a group of people in Jinja (Jinja Municipality, Jinja) killed an LGBT activist. The man was hacked in the head with a garden tool.

On 3 October 2019, police fired tear gas to disperse students at Kyambogo Univerity (Kampala), as part of an intra-student protest which centred upon an attempt to impeach the president of the student guild. The details are unclear. [size=no report]

On 1 October 2019, demonstrators blocked a highway with rocks and burned tires at Itojo trading centre (Ntungamo district, coordinates for Nyongozi used at prec2), following a spate of murders in the area. Police and UPDF dispersed the crowds with tear gas and live rounds. [size=no report]

On 30 September 2019, medical students from Busitema University demonstrated in Mbale (Mbale district), at changes in the internship structure, and a lack of money. Police prevented the demonstrators from continuing their march, on the grounds that they did not have a permit. [size=no report]

On 30 September 2019, a lynch mob (including motorcycle taxi drivers) beat a suspected thief in Itojo (Ntungamo district, coordinates for Nyongozi used at prec2), who was rescued by police and taken to Itojo hospital. The mob broke into the hospital and killed the suspected thief. [size=no report]

On 30 September 2019, medical students demonstrated at Gulu University (Gulu district), in protest at changes in the structure of internships. Police dispersed the demonstrators with tear gas. [size=hundreds]

On 30 September 2019, students rioted at Kasese Youth Polytechnic (Kasese district), smashing windows and furniture in protest at the poor quality of sanitation, and the lack of practical lessons, whilst accusing the principal of corruption. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-); Labour Group (Uganda)
notes: On 30 September 2019, demonstrators attacked a truck carrying charcoal at Awach (Gulu district), and reportedly attempted to kill the eight occupants of the truck and set the vehicle on fire. Police used live rounds to disperse the crowds. [size=300]

On 29 September 2019, a mob gathered in Rubabi village (Rukungiri district, coordinates for Nyakageme used at prec2) to avenge the death of a man killed in a fight. The mob attempted to attack the home the father of the suspected killers, and torched three dwellings in the vicinity. Police deployed to prevent the mob from killing their target. [size=no report]
28 September. Residents of Railway village in Layibi protested the bad state of a local road. [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Military Police
notes: 26 September. The FDC Deputy Secretary General Kaija was arrested by Military Police forces on his way from Kibaire voting station.

On 25 September 2019, vendors protested at the Central Market in Jinja (Jinja district), protesting alleged interference by political and security officials in the running of the market. They prevented the new chairperson from accessing the market. [size=dozens]
24 September. Students of Bukalasa Agricultural College protested in Wobulenzi over poor sanitary conditions at the institute. Police forces used teargas to disperse the crowd. [size=1800]

24 September. Residents of Nyarugugu and a group of refugees from Nakivale got engaged in a street-fight over fishing practices in a local lake (no geo location known, coded as Nakivale). One person killed. [size=no report]
24 September (or around). Police forces prevented FDC supporters and Bobi Wine from passing through Hoima town centre. [size=no report]
On 24 September 2019, Bako Olang militia killed a man at Barayom village (Amolatar district, coordinates for Amolatar used at precision), as part of a land dispute.
23 September. Uber taxi drivers protested poor working conditions at the companies HQ in Kampala. [size=no report]
22 September (or around). Taxi drivers from two rivaling companies got engaged in a street-fight over their taxi parks in Kawempe. 19 people were injured and 25 taxis vandalized. [size=no report)

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
notes: On 22 September 2019, soldiers from the Fisheries Protection Unit shot at fish traders at an unspecified location between Tooro-Semliki Game Reserve and Karugutu market (coordinates for Mongiro, Bundibygyo district, used at prec2). One was killed in the gunfire, whilst the truck carrying the traders turned over in the pursuit, killing an additional person and wounding 14 others.
21 September (or around). Residents of Mbarara protested the introduction of garbage fees. [size=no report]
21 September (or around). Residents along the Kaliro-Kamuli road protested the bad state of the street. [size=no report]
20 September. Traders protested ongoing road construction works that cut off the access to a market in Kampala. [size=no report]
20 September. Students in Kampala participated in the global climate strike and staged a protest in town. [size=hundreds]
20 September. Demonstrators 2km off Palabek protested a demarcation exercise conducted by National Forestry Authority. [size=no report]
20 September. Residents of Apyeta Parish protested the re-opening of the Aswa River Forest Reserve land by National Forestry Authority. [size=hundreds]

18 September. Police forces used live bullets and teargas to disperse FDC supporters in Hoima who protested the exclusion of their candidate from radio shows. No injuries reported from the protesters. [size=no report]
18 September (or around). Millers in Soroti protested the poor power supply at the UMEME office in town. [size=no report]
18 September. Students at Gulu University protested the bad state of the toilet facilities. [size=no report]
17 September. Residents of Bulambuli district protested the bad state of the Buyaga-Buluganya road. [size=no report]

On 17 September 2019, demonstrators blocked roads at Iriiri (Napak district), throwing stones at vehicles, in a bid to stop construction workers entering the town, following news that the size of the road under construction for the town was to be reduced. [size=no report]

On 16 September 2019, motorcycle taxi drivers protested the killings of their colleagues over the past weeks and stormed shops in Kasambya (Mubende district). Police and Military forces used teargas and live ammunition to control the crowd. One taxi driver was shot and injured. [size=no report]

On 16 September 2019, protesters aligned to a candidate seeking to be elected as Bunyole cutural leader demonstrated at Butaleja town (Butaleja district), claiming that his opponent was not from the area, and was therefore ineligible to run. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Gawaar Nuer Ethnic Group (South Sudan); Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan)
assoc_actor_2: Laak Clan Group (South Sudan); Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan)
notes: On 16 September 2019, Gawaar and Laak Nuer refugees clashed at Kiryandongo refugee camp (Kiryandongo district), following an illigitimate pregnancy. The Laak Nuer leader in the camp was killed, and a camp court official also died. Police intervened. [size=large]

On 15 September 2019, a South Sudanese journalist was abducted in Kampala, and beaten by four men (two of who the reporter said appeared to be Ugandan, and two South Sudanese). The journalist escaped during the attack.

On or before September 10th, residents of Alim village in Pukor parish (Pader district, approximates coordinates based on online mapping service used at prec2) protested against the unexpected arrival of cattle and pastoralists in the area. [size=no report]

On 9 September 2019, street children rioted in Jinja (Jinja district) after the shelter they had been using was dismantled by police. The children torched various market stalls in the area. Police dispersed the rioters with tear gas, and made 20 arrests. [size=80]

On 9 September 2019, students of Hoima Nursing School (Hoima district) demonstrated against the quality of the school and the dismissal of staff by the principal, throwing stones at anyone who approached the school buildings. [size=no report]

On 7 September 2019, police intercepted an FDC rally in Mbale town (Mbale district), dispersing protesters with tear gas and live rounds, and arresting four (including a senior member). [size=no report]

On 7 September 2019, a mob beat and robbed a police superintendent (who was not acting in his capacity as a police officer, and coded as a civilian) at Parajwoki (Hoima district), as part of a land dispite in the area. Eight people have been arrested. [size=8]

On or before September 2nd, police rescued an alleged sorcerer from his house in Kginga, Mukono after a mob had formed outside. When police attempted to escort the man from the building the crowd advanced upon him, prompting police to disperse the crowd with live rounds. [size=no report]

On 1 September 2019, an NGO worker was attacked by an unknown group outside his house in Bweyale town (Kiryandongo district), and died of his wounds (inflicted by bladed weapons) the following day. The source notes that the victim had been lured outside by somebody impersonating his friend.

On 1 September 2019, attendees of a music festival in Mpatta, Mukono turned violent after an advertised performer did not turn up. A police officer shot and killed a demonstrator during the disturbance, and has since been arrested. [size=no report]
On 30 August 2019, a student suspected of being involved in a robbery at a hotel in Jinja was killed by a mob. [size=small]

On 29 August 2019, two men attacked a man they accused of being an NRM supporter (owing to the yellow beret he had on him) in Kalerwe (Kampala). The assailants drove a nail through both of his hands, attaching the beret to them. The victim has had the nail removed in hospital. It is unclear who the attackers were (coded as UAG).

On 29 August 2019, demonstrators marched to the Bushenyi-Ishaka municipality offices (Beshenyi district) to protest against the sale of land which would see the closure of a pork market. The sale relates to a long-standing land dispute and legal case between local authorities and a businessman. [size=no report]

On or after August 28th, the head of an NGO and a friend were abducted and killed by unknown attackers in the Busega area of Kampala. Initial reports suggested no ransom had been asked for. 10 people have so far been arrested in connection with the attack.

On or around August 27th, a mob gathered to attack a mentally-unstable woman who had allegedly murdered her baby. Police intervened to prevent the mob from killing her, and are investigating the death of the baby. The event occurred in Lukunu village (Luuka district). [size=no report]

On 26 August 2019, students demonstrated at Kabale University at Kitumba (Kabale district), following the decision by the University to considerably increase tuition fees, and to compel students to retake an academic year if they fail a module. Police used tear gas and live rounds to disperse the protesters. [size=200]

On 23 August 2019, residents of an unspecified location along the road between Jinja and Kamuli in Jinja Municipality (coordinates for Jinja used at prec2) protested against the installation of a mobile phone mast in their village. The residents then attacked 'porters' (presumed to be workers installing the mast) injuring one. [size=no report]

On 22 August 2019, youth supporters of Bobi Wine MP gathered in Mpenja (Gomba district), upon hearing news that Bobi Wine was returning to the area for a funeral. Police used live rounds and tear gas against protesters, causing several injuries, and unsuccessfully attempted to detain Bobi Wine, who evaded their checkpoints. [size=large]

On 21 August 2019, boda boda drivers blocked a road an unspecified location in Mafubira sub-county (Jinja state, coordinates for Mafubira used at prec2), following the death of a colleague in an accident involving a truck. The demonstrators vandalised the truck, and police used live rounds and tear gas to disperse the crowd. [size=no report]

On 21 August 2019, demonstrators from the West Nile region protested at Arua Park in Kampala, against deaths of high-profile figures from their community in recent years, and calling for extra security for a minister who hails from the area. [size=hundreds]
On 20 August 2019, lorry drivers protested in Busia (Busia district), following the imposition of a new levy and parking fees in the town. [size=no report]

On 13 August 2019, a mob attacked two suspected cattle thieves at Nakitolo village in Tamu (Mityana district, coordinates for Tamu used at prec2). One victim was killed by the mob, though police intervened to save the second. [size=small]

On 12 August 2019, residents of the Bardege suburb of Gulu demonstrated along the road running between Gulu town centre and Bardege, in protest at the very poor condition of the road, and planted crops along it. Demonstrators blocked the road with rocks and tires. Later, the protesters peacefully escorted a local MP along the road to show its poor quality. [size=hundreds]

On 12 August 2019, demonstrators blocked a road at Namakwekwe (Mbale district), in opposition to the high number of road deaths in the area. The demonstrators used burning tires, stones and logs, and were dispersed when police fired tear gas into the crowd. [size=no report]

At an unspecified time after the death of a suspect in police custody on August 9th (and coded for August 10th at time prec2), protesters demonstrated at the police post in Kiwenda (Wakiso district), calling for justice for the victim of suspected police torture. [size=no report]

On 9 August 2019, a suspected thief died in police custody in Kiwenda (Wakiso district), with three police officers accused of torturing him to death (note: the police officers have claimed that the suspect died as a result of a lynch mob). Two officers have been detained, and the third is at large.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
notes: On 8 August 2019, market vendors protested the eviction of street vendors at Kalerwe market (Kampala). Police and LDU intervened, though demonstrators threw stones at the forces after they began to impound merchandise belonging to street vendors. Tear gas was used to disperse the crowds, and four were arrested. [size=no report]

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 7 August 2019, six armed men believed to be from the DRC (and coded as such) abducted a woman at Kanyashande (Kanungu district, coordinates for Kashesha used at prec2).

On 7 August 2019, residents of Nakabago demonstrated against the placement of a school gate on a path used by residents in part of a land dispute. The residents broke down the iron gates of the school; three demonstrators were arrested. [size=small]

On 7 August 2019, a landlord was killed at Minaana village (Mityana district, coordinates for Tamu used at prec2), amidst a land dispute. Six people have been arrested (including the village chairperson), and a number of suspects have left the village.

On 7 August 2019, a mob comprised of Uganda and Kenya citizens killed a suspected motorbike thief at Alupe village (Busia district; no geographic information found, coordinates for Busia used at prec3). [size=no report]

On 5 August 2019, a soldier attacked a pregnant woman at Maruzi ranch in Ibuje sub-district (Apac district, coordinates for Ibuje used at prec2). The attacker beat the woman after she refused to have sex with him, and he has since been arrested.

On 4 August 2019, Zigy Wyne (the stage name of Michael Kalinda) - a musician and supporter of Bobi Wine MP - died at a hospital in Kampala, having been abducted by unknown men two weeks prior, and being subject to mutilation and torture. Bobi Wine has suggested the death was the work of government authorities, whilst police are treating the case as a murder. (Note: date of death used for the event, given the unclear date of abduction)

On 2 August 2019, residents of four sub-counties which adjoin Mt Elgon National Park protested at the District HQ in Mbale town (Mbale district), following alleged encorachment by Wildlife Authority rangers onto the land of the sub-counties, which residents fear pressages a withdrawal of their land rights. [size=no report]
On 1 August 2019, a group of motorcycle taxi drivers in the district of Wakiso (Busiro, Wakiso) killed a young transgender woman. She was beaten to death. [size=no report]

During the week commencing July 29th, two men were detained by state security agents at Mutungo (Wakiso district), with the agents shooting one man in the leg after he fled. Police have acknowledged that a 'sister agency' has detained the two men, but have not specified which one (actor1 coded as police pending further information).

On 31 July 2019, a police officer was killed as he slept at the police post in Ayivuni sub-county (Arua district, coordinates for Mingoro used at prec2), by an unknown group who cut him with bladed weapons.

On 27 July 2019, youth (armed with machetes and bows) from Palorinya attacked the vehicle of an MP, before attacking Iboa village (Moyo district, coordinates for Palorinya used at prec2), injuring four, and torching a number of dwellings. The dispute centres around the relocation of the area to the newly created Obongi district.
On 26 July 2019, college students demonstrated in Kitgum (Kitgum district), throwing stones at teachers and damaging school property. [size=no report]

On 25 July 2019, students from two secondary schools in Mbale (Mbale district) clashed following escalating disputes. Police fired teargas at the students, causing 50 hospitalizations, mostly of female students. [size=dozens]

On 24 July 2019, Democratic Party members met in Luwero town (Luwero district) to plan for an upcoming rally. Police told the DP members to leave as they did not have a permit, but the members refused on the grounds that it was an internal party event. Police fired tear gas to disperse the members. [size=40]

On 24 June 2019, newly unemployed workers at Tembo Steels plant in Iganga town (Iganga district) demonstrated at the steel plant, preventing vehicles from entering or leaving. The dispute relates to the rapid dismissal of workers and salary arrears. [size=168]

On 24 July 2019, a lynch mob (which included boda boda drivers) attacked and killed two men in Kabatanagi cell (Kiruhura, coordinates for Kazo used at prec2). The victims had been accused of stealing a motorbike. [size=small]

On 22 June 2019, a Karamajong militia attacked Teso civilians in two villages (Oiselem and Okameta) of Apeitolim parish (Napak state, coordinates used), burning dwellings and displacing between 300-450 residents. There are no reports of injuries. The attacks relate to a tense border dispute on the frontier of Napak.

On 22 July 2019, a 17 year-old student was killed by a lynch mob of vendors after he was accused of stealing from Rushebeya market (Rukiga district, coordinates for Kitanga town used at prec2). [size=small]

On 21 July 2019, men armed with spears and machetes were reported to have been attacking residents in Nyakahaama village (Kyenjojo district, coordinates for Ganuinayo used at prec2). The men were allegedly employed by a man who has claimed the land as his own. At least two people were injured in the attacks.

On or around July 10th, a civilian from the Jie ethnic group was attacked and killed by a Dodoth mob, who accused him of being a cattle thief. The event occurred at Kalongo bridge (Kaabong district, coordinates for Kaabong used at prec2). [size=small]

On 1 July 2019, protesters gathered once more in Mbale (Mbale district), demonstrating against the failure of authorities to address the problems of leaking sewage in the town (note: demonstrators blocked the road, but unclear if intentional). [size=no report]

On June 28th-29th, police and UPDF clashed with students in Arua (Arua district), who were attempting to attack rival student teams at a sport event in the town. Tear gas and live rounds were used to disperse the students, who were armed with sticks, and one ringleader was arrested. [size=large]

On June 28th-29th, police and UPDF clashed with students in Arua (Arua district), who were attempting to attack rival student teams at a sport event in the town. Tear gas and live rounds were used to disperse the students, who were armed with sticks, and one ringleader was arrested. [size=large]

On 27 June 2019, a mob hacked a traditional healer to death at Bondu-Alwala village (Pakwach district, coordinates for Alwi used at prec2) and wounded another woman, following the death of a teenager she was giving medical advice to, and burned 15 houses. During the week beginning June 24th, demonstrators gathered in Mbale town (Mbale district), protesting the leaking sewage in the town. Authorities pledged to address the issues raised by the protesters. [size=no report]

On 26 June 2019, members of the Atiak clan attacked Panyigoro clan members in Panyigoro parish (Pakwach district), as part of a historic land dispute. The two groups clashed, and 50 dwellings were torched and 40 head of cattle killed, and three people have gone missing. Eight Atiak youths have been arrested.

On 25 June 2019, a Tanzanian national was kidnapped in or around Nakalinzi village (Kyotara district, coordinates for Mutukula used at prec2). A police officer and soldier have been arrested on suspicion of kidnapping, after they had claimed the ransom from the family.
On 24 June 2019, security guards and lorry drivers fought in Mpondwe (Kasese district). Police and military intervened, and shot and wounded three people, one seriously. [size=no report]

The source indicates she was held for several weeks, and tortured by her captors, before being released on July 19th.

On June 22nd or 23rd, boda boda drivers attacked and killed a suspected thief in Mulago (Kampala). A police officer attempted to rescue the victim, though was initially prevented from doing so. [size=small]
On or after June 22nd, a cattle keeper was killed by suspect Jie raiders at Wii Kweyo (Agago district, coordinates for Lokole used at prec2).

On 21 June 2019, a 7 year-old girl was abducted by suspected members of the Gimara clan of the Kakwa ethnic group at a farm in Anyanga village in Kuluba sub-county (Koboko district),owned by the descendants of a former Ugandan vice-president under Idi Amin. The attackers also damaged property on the farm. The girl has not been found as of April 2020. The abduction is linked to a land dispute. [women targeted: girls]

On 21 June 2019, a suspected cattle rustler from Karamajong was shot dead at an unspecified location in Palam sub-county (Katakwi, coordinates for Alekilek used at prec2). There is no further information, including information on the attackers.
